Examples ['the men, who will be able to apply for parole to avoid serving the full 25 years, were immediately taken into custody after the sentencing and whisked out of the courtroom in handcuffs.\n The question is: kozlowski and swartz, who were found guilty of stealing more than $150 million from the company, were each sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "kozlowski and the company's former chief financial officer, mark swartz, were sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.\n The question is: a new york state judge also ordered kozlowski and former chief financial officer, mark swartz, to serve 25 years in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", 'a prosecutor had urged a state judge to sentence former tyco international ceo, dennis kozlowski, to the maximum 15 to 30 years in prison for stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from the company.\n The question is: ex-tyco ceo, dennis kozlowski, received 8-1/3 to 25 years in prison, monday, for his part in stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from the manufacturing conglomerate.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "kozlowski and the company's former chief financial officer, mark swartz, were sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.\n The question is: two former bosses of us manufacturer, tyco, have been sentenced to up to 25 years in jail for stealing more than $150m (Â£m) from the company.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", 'martha stewart, 64, is back, after serving five months in a west virginia federal prison for lying about a 2001 stock sale.\n The question is: martha stewart was convicted of lying about a stock trade and served five months in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'former peruvian president alberto fujimori has been sentenced to 25 years in jail for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces. at the end of a 15-month trial, judges found him guilty of two death-squad killings of 25 people during the conflict with guerrillas in the 1990s. after being sentenced, mr fujimori said he would appeal against the verdict. human rights group amnesty international described the verdict as "a milestone in the fight for justice".\n The question is: alberto fujimori has been sentenced to life in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'two other marines, tyler jackson and john jodka iii, have already pleaded guilty to aggravated assault and conspiracy to obstruct justice and were sentenced to 21 months and 18 months, respectively.\n The question is: tyler jackson has been sentenced to 18 months.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'a u.s. soldier accused of participating in the rape of an iraqi girl and then killing her and her family was sentenced to 90 years in jail on thursday, media reports said.\n The question is: a u.s. soldier was sentenced to 90 years in jail.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'hacking reported his wife missing on july 19, a monday.\n The question is: mark hacking was booked into the salt lake county jail on monday.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'nichols, 49, was convicted in the april 19, 1995, bombing of the alfred p. murrah federal building in oklahoma city.\n The question is: nichols was sentenced to life in prison for the april 19, 1995, bombing of the oklahoma city federal building.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "gm established grounds for suspicion of industrial spying by presenting affidavits from its employees. the aim will be to determine if vw's project was copied from gm data - essential if industrial espionage is to be proved.\n The question is: there was an industrial espionage case involving gm and vw.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the industrial espionage case involving gm and vw began with the hiring of jos ignacio lopez, an employee of gm subsidiary adam opel, by vw as production director.\n The question is: there was an industrial espionage case involving gm and vw.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'state police issued bulletins via teletype requesting patrols to be on the lookout for robert senacal, 35, of cortlandt manor.\n The question is: robert senacal was arrested by police.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'in documents they filed with the u.s. district court for the district of columbia, government lawyers argued that three inmates who committed suicide last month by hanging themselves coordinated their actions by using attorney-client confidentiality to communicate with each other. government officials said that among papers marked "attorney client privilege" were instructions on how to tie knots and a classified memo on camp activities and inmate locations.\n The question is: three people committed suicide in jail.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'zhao, who died at 85, was a reformer who was removed from office, and imprisoned, in 1989 after denouncing the use of force against student protesters in tiananmen square.\n The question is: zhao was arrested in 1989.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a priest who served in the diocese of metuchen in the mid-1980s has been sentenced to life in prison for sexually abusing a massachusetts boy.\n The question is: pedophile gets life in prison. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true']

Examples ['the men, who will be able to apply for parole to avoid serving the full 25 years, were immediately taken into custody after the sentencing and whisked out of the courtroom in handcuffs.\n The question is: kozlowski and swartz, who were found guilty of stealing more than $150 million from the company, were each sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "kozlowski and the company's former chief financial officer, mark swartz, were sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.\n The question is: a new york state judge also ordered kozlowski and former chief financial officer, mark swartz, to serve 25 years in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", 'a prosecutor had urged a state judge to sentence former tyco international ceo, dennis kozlowski, to the maximum 15 to 30 years in prison for stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from the company.\n The question is: ex-tyco ceo, dennis kozlowski, received 8-1/3 to 25 years in prison, monday, for his part in stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from the manufacturing conglomerate.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "kozlowski and the company's former chief financial officer, mark swartz, were sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.\n The question is: two former bosses of us manufacturer, tyco, have been sentenced to up to 25 years in jail for stealing more than $150m (Â£m) from the company.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", 'martha stewart, 64, is back, after serving five months in a west virginia federal prison for lying about a 2001 stock sale.\n The question is: martha stewart was convicted of lying about a stock trade and served five months in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'former peruvian president alberto fujimori has been sentenced to 25 years in jail for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces. at the end of a 15-month trial, judges found him guilty of two death-squad killings of 25 people during the conflict with guerrillas in the 1990s. after being sentenced, mr fujimori said he would appeal against the verdict. human rights group amnesty international described the verdict as "a milestone in the fight for justice".\n The question is: alberto fujimori has been sentenced to life in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'two other marines, tyler jackson and john jodka iii, have already pleaded guilty to aggravated assault and conspiracy to obstruct justice and were sentenced to 21 months and 18 months, respectively.\n The question is: tyler jackson has been sentenced to 18 months.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'a u.s. soldier accused of participating in the rape of an iraqi girl and then killing her and her family was sentenced to 90 years in jail on thursday, media reports said.\n The question is: a u.s. soldier was sentenced to 90 years in jail.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'hacking reported his wife missing on july 19, a monday.\n The question is: mark hacking was booked into the salt lake county jail on monday.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'nichols, 49, was convicted in the april 19, 1995, bombing of the alfred p. murrah federal building in oklahoma city.\n The question is: nichols was sentenced to life in prison for the april 19, 1995, bombing of the oklahoma city federal building.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "gm established grounds for suspicion of industrial spying by presenting affidavits from its employees. the aim will be to determine if vw's project was copied from gm data - essential if industrial espionage is to be proved.\n The question is: there was an industrial espionage case involving gm and vw.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the industrial espionage case involving gm and vw began with the hiring of jos ignacio lopez, an employee of gm subsidiary adam opel, by vw as production director.\n The question is: there was an industrial espionage case involving gm and vw.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'state police issued bulletins via teletype requesting patrols to be on the lookout for robert senacal, 35, of cortlandt manor.\n The question is: robert senacal was arrested by police.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'in documents they filed with the u.s. district court for the district of columbia, government lawyers argued that three inmates who committed suicide last month by hanging themselves coordinated their actions by using attorney-client confidentiality to communicate with each other. government officials said that among papers marked "attorney client privilege" were instructions on how to tie knots and a classified memo on camp activities and inmate locations.\n The question is: three people committed suicide in jail.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'zhao, who died at 85, was a reformer who was removed from office, and imprisoned, in 1989 after denouncing the use of force against student protesters in tiananmen square.\n The question is: zhao was arrested in 1989.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a priest who served in the diocese of metuchen in the mid-1980s has been sentenced to life in prison for sexually abusing a massachusetts boy.\n The question is: pedophile gets life in prison. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true']

Examples ['the men, who will be able to apply for parole to avoid serving the full 25 years, were immediately taken into custody after the sentencing and whisked out of the courtroom in handcuffs.\n The question is: kozlowski and swartz, who were found guilty of stealing more than $150 million from the company, were each sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "kozlowski and the company's former chief financial officer, mark swartz, were sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.\n The question is: a new york state judge also ordered kozlowski and former chief financial officer, mark swartz, to serve 25 years in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", 'a prosecutor had urged a state judge to sentence former tyco international ceo, dennis kozlowski, to the maximum 15 to 30 years in prison for stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from the company.\n The question is: ex-tyco ceo, dennis kozlowski, received 8-1/3 to 25 years in prison, monday, for his part in stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from the manufacturing conglomerate.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "kozlowski and the company's former chief financial officer, mark swartz, were sentenced, on monday, to up to 25 years in prison.\n The question is: two former bosses of us manufacturer, tyco, have been sentenced to up to 25 years in jail for stealing more than $150m (Â£m) from the company.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'former peruvian president alberto fujimori has been sentenced to 25 years in jail for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces. at the end of a 15-month trial, judges found him guilty of two death-squad killings of 25 people during the conflict with guerrillas in the 1990s. after being sentenced, mr fujimori said he would appeal against the verdict. human rights group amnesty international described the verdict as "a milestone in the fight for justice".\n The question is: alberto fujimori has been sentenced to life in prison.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the industrial espionage case involving gm and vw began with the hiring of jos ignacio lopez, an employee of gm subsidiary adam opel, by vw as production director.\n The question is: there was an industrial espionage case involving gm and vw.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", '"i want to go back again. but i am afraid, honestly, i am afraid. propaganda against me made people think i am terrorist.", said el-nashar.\n The question is: el-nashar is accused of terrorism.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", 'the university has also apologized for the incident saying, "[we] are very sorry that the incident happened and the person will be dealt with according to law. the university is a place for discussion, debate and considered argument, not for shoe throwing". according to authorities, there was never any real threat to the prime minister. the man will appear before a judge on february 10.\n The question is: a man threw a shoe at the prime minister.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'true'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true']

True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'true'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'a syrian-american airman accused of espionage complained about prisoner treatment at the us base in guantanamo, cuba.\n The question is: american accused of espionage. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'false'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false']

Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.', 'hypothesis': 'alistair darling is chancellor of uk.', 'label': 'true'}]]
Examples ['two greenpeace protestors entered the cbi conference at the business design centre in islington, london and delayed a speech being made by the prime minister tony blair, in which he was expected to announce the consideration of further nuclear power stations to offset the increasing gas prices being experienced by industry in the uk. the protestors, wearing yellow safety jackets over business suits, climbed up into the ceiling rafters and held  banners saying "nuclear: wrong answer", and dropped \'radioactive confetti\' onto the delegates down below. greenpeace threatened to make noise and throw missiles at the prime minister should he make his speech.\n The question is: greenpeace made a statement about yellow safety jackets.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'paul watson, the founder of greenpeace, will speak on campus wednesday, march 3.\n The question is: paul watson is the founder of greenpeace.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', "radical jordanian cleric, abu qatada, and nine other foreign nationals said to pose a threat to the uk's security, have been detained, pending deportation.\n The question is: 10 foreign nationals were a threat to britian's national security.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true", "the prime minister's office and the foreign office had earlier purposely asserted that the case is strictly in the jurisdiction of the police and the justice system.\n The question is: the jurisdiction of the case was queried by the prime minister and the ministry of foreign affairs.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'protesters, many from organized pro-government groups but including many ordinary citizens, carried anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.\n The question is: protesters confiscated anti-american banners and chanted slogans attacking u.n. secretary-general kofi annan for his close alignment with u.s. policy.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', '"instead of action on crime, we got the federal long gun registry, which became a bloated bureaucratic nightmare to responsible hunters, farmers and rural canadians. it cost taxpayers some ca$2 billion and it hasn\'t done a thing to reduce gun crime." said harper. the conservatives have provided amnesty for unregistered gun owners. at this time there is no legislation set before the house of commons. conservative garry breitkreuz from saskatchewan tabled the bill killing the long-gun registry.\n The question is: garry breitkreuz is a member of the conservative party.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true', 'the father of an oxnard teenager accused of gunning down a gay classmate who was romantically attracted to him has been found dead, ventura county authorities said today.  bill mcinerney, 45, was found shortly before 8 a.m. in the living room of his silver strand home by a friend, said james baroni, ventura county\'s chief deputy medical examiner. the friend was supposed to drive him to a court hearing in his son\'s murder trial, baroni said.  mcinerney\'s 15-year-old son, brandon, is accused of murder and a hate crime in the feb. 12, 2008, shooting death of classmate lawrence "larry" king, 15. the two boys had been sparring in the days before the killing, allegedly because larry had expressed a romantic interest in brandon.\n The question is: bill mcinerney is accused of killing a gay teenager.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', "the board of marks & spencer will take another look at philip green's increased takeover offer.\n The question is: philip green tries to take over marks & spencer.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: false', 'any taxpayer earning over Â£150,000 will no longer enjoy higher-rate tax relief, which is considered a substantial incentive to save for wealthy workers. from april 2011, anyone who earns Â£200,000 a year, for example, and pays the typical amount of 6 per cent of their salary into their company pension scheme will lose out on Â£200 a month or Â£2,400 a year.  alistair darling, when he announced the move in the budget, insisted that just 1.5 per cent of taxpayers - the equivalent of about 450,000 people - would be hit, but experts argued that it would significantly damage the already beleaguered pensions industry, and cause many savers to think twice about investing in a pension.\n The question is: alistair darling is chancellor of uk.. True or False?\nThe Answer is: true']
